question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: Validate(ProposalInfo)] [Null ExpiredTime] Can proposal.ExpiredTime be null despite the null check on line 89, if it's set to null after validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: Validate(ProposalInfo)] [Short-Circuit Logic] If ToAddress is null, does the function return false before checking ExpiredTime, potentially missing other validation issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: Validate(ProposalInfo)] [Far Future Expiry] Can proposals be created with ExpiredTime set to year 9999, effectively never expiring and bloating state storage? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Empty String Bypass] Does line 94-95 returning true for empty strings allow attackers to create proposals without description URLs when they should be required? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Scheme Restriction] Does line 97 correctly restrict to only http/https, or can attackers use javascript:, data:, or file: schemes through Uri.TryCreate vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Absolute URI Only] Does UriKind.Absolute on line 96 prevent relative URLs, or can attackers exploit this to create misleading proposal descriptions? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [Malformed URL] Can Uri.TryCreate succeed for malformed URLs that later cause exceptions when accessed, creating DOS vectors? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme()] [URL Length] Does this function validate URL length before Uri.TryCreate, or can extremely long URLs (millions of characters) cause performance issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [TOCTOU] Can an attacker exploit time-of-check-time-of-use race between line 103 retrieving proposal and line 105 validating it, if proposal state changes concurrently? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Null Proposal] Does line 104 correctly handle the case where State.Proposals[proposalId] returns a non-null but invalid/corrupted proposal object? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Validation Bypass] Can Validate(proposal) on line 105 pass for an expired proposal if Context.CurrentBlockTime is manipulated between creation and validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GetValidProposal()] [Error Message] Does 'Invalid proposal id.' on line 104 leak information about which proposal IDs exist vs. which are truly invalid? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Hash Collision] Can two different CreateOrganizationInput objects produce the same organizationHash on line 112, allowing organization address collision? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Deterministic Address] Is the ConvertVirtualAddressToContractAddressWithContractHashName deterministic - can an attacker predict organization addresses before creation for front-running? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Virtual Hash Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate CalculateVirtualHash on line 116 by providing malicious creationToken to control the resulting organization address? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Address Collision] Can two organizations with different inputs but same virtual hash result in the same organization address, breaking uniqueness? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Creation Token Reuse] If the same creationToken is used for multiple organizations, does this cause address collision or is each still unique? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Null Token Bypass] If creationToken is null on line 127, does this skip token-based uniqueness, allowing multiple organizations with same organizationHash? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Hash Collision] Can HashHelper.ConcatAndCompute on line 129 produce collisions if attackers craft organizationHash and creationToken pairs strategically? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Deterministic Output] Is the ternary operator on lines 127-129 the only difference in virtual hash calculation, making it predictable for attackers? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Double Vote Detection] Does the OR condition on line 134-135 correctly prevent double voting if Contains() checks have race conditions in concurrent voting scenarios? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Vote List Manipulation] If sender appears in multiple lists (Approvals AND Rejections), does line 137 still fire assertion, or is there a bypass? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Address Comparison] Do Contains() checks use proper address equality, or can an attacker vote multiple times using different address formats for the same sender? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Performance DOS] If proposal lists contain millions of addresses, can Contains() operations on lines 134-135 cause transaction timeout, preventing legitimate votes? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Proposal ID Collision] Can Context.GenerateId produce duplicate proposal IDs if called with same input.Token multiple times, allowing proposal replacement attacks? (Critical)
